TopicTitle: What Do you do when you are bored and playing KSP?

Articles.Content: Hello! I am posting this to see if anyone else does the same stupid crap I do when I am bored and playing KSP. So I have "told my kerbals" that every now and then the sun (Kerbol) needs a kerbal sacrifice. Basically, I take a kerbal and launch in at the sun and sacrifice it to the Sun god of the Solar system, appeasing it for a little while and sparing the explosion of itself. So, that's usually what I do, but what do you do when your are bored and playing KSP?
I listen to music. It certainly helps, cause KSP can be lonely sometimes, specially with the eerie music and all.

The only "boring" parts for me are the long coasts during interplanetary flight--I don't usually set my accel to max, because I keep feeling that somehow the sim engine could perhaps be more accurate in plotting my trajectory (processor crunching) if I don't time accel too much...which leaves me like half-hour or an hour of wait time before any significant activity like a correction burn. So what I do is watch some space-related stuff on YouTube or one of my space documentary movies. Sometimes I also play a guitar and sing songs that are somehow tied to space travel. Sometimes I also chat to friends via Skype or FB and telling (broadcasting LOL) them that "I'm headed for another planet" and you can imagine the sort of reaction that statement can give you hehe

So in a sense, KSP is like that old fighter pilot adage...long hours of waiting and boredom, punctuated by moments of sheer terror!

I usually try to do something that I haven't done before. . . like put an ion probe on a grand tour, or build a rocket powered one seat rover substitute to better scout planets(rovers are slow). Most recently, I've been trying to figure out how to do a proper gravity assist. I can finagle it with maneuver nodes until it lines up, but I want to find out how to line it up using maths if I can.

So yea, stuff like that. This game is awesome:)
I'm never bored when playing this game.

I find Kerbal Space Program sometimes gets boring when everything goes well. The long ascents, the long transfers to other planets, the long, slow burns to get that perfect orbit... They can be boring, even when they work out perfectly.

So, I inject some failure to spice things up every so often. With me at the controls, nothing says 'failure' like a spaceplane! Seriously though, any plane I build with more than nine parts is guaranteed to explode shortly after takeoff, if it even manages to get that far.Even with a functional abort system, I go through a lot of test pilots.

Edited May 29, 2013 by Hugo Ball

When I'm bored I don't like doing things that require patience. So instead I load up my second save for messing around, and just play with the buttons on hyper edit.

One time I put the Mun out between Kerbin and Duna and did a mock asteroid mission. Sadly to lander didn't survived and they got marooned. Oops.

I don't have issue using max acceleration and being a father I'm generally only allowed an hour of play time, so I rarely get bored....though I'm going to try to stop relying on quicksave, I get that feeling that I cheated everytime I hit F9.
